EC Bans Vivek Oberoi's Modi Biopic One Day Before Its Release & The Internet Is Celebrating!
Bollywood actor Vivek Oberoi was in news recently for starring in the biopic of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Receiving severe backlash on the subject and the timing of its release (11th April), Vivek Oberoi took on criticism and gave a befitting reply.
Twitter
From being seen on debates to heavily promoting his upcoming film, speaking about his off and on stint in Bollywood, Vivek Oberoi said, "I'm still here and unbreakable." His film was earlier touted to release on 4th April, however, opposition parties alleged that the movie has an intention of influencing voters in the run-up to the Lok Sabha elections.
Twitter
Soon the movie shifted to 11th April but now in a fresh set of events, EC has banned the biopic citing 'disturbs level-playing field' They have mentioned there will be no biopic till the polls end.

Here are some of the fresh reactions on Twitter after the movie got postponed.
Finally a good decision made by EC.
Vivek Ab roye 😂 ( i was waiting to say this😅).#NoMoreModi #EkHiChowkidarChorHai — Rohma Ansari (@ansari_rohma) April 10, 2019
Finally it seems EC has awake — Shrenik Chhajer (@shrenikchhajer) April 10, 2019
NaMo TV bhi band karo — Sasikumar (@Sasikum36004064) April 10, 2019
The film-makers should be ashamed of themselves for trying to release this biopic at a time like this. Complete irresponsibility! — Pallavi Deka (@pallavi_deka) April 10, 2019
चलो मतलब मोदीजी ने मूवी देख ली। 😂😂 — Pulkit Sankhla (@PulKitnaBolega) April 10, 2019
Supreme Court had earlier given a go-ahead to the movie but EC has put the movie on hold.
Well, we can't wait to see how this movie will eventually turn out to be.
